summary: This is an email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, dated January 30, 2020, regarding Prince Andrew's lack of cooperation with the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. It references Prince Andrew's public offer to help from November 2019 and U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman's public statement on January 27, 2020, that Prince Andrew had provided 'zero cooperation.' The email contains final language to be sent, pressing for an interview commitment.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.role: Subject of investigation, individual who publicly offered cooperation
persons.context: Publicly offered to cooperate with the Epstein investigation in November 2019 but, according to the U.S. Attorney's Office, has provided 'zero cooperation' and has not scheduled an interview as of late January 2020.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Made a public statement on January 27, 2020, correcting the impression that Prince Andrew was cooperating and stating that Prince Andrew had provided zero cooperation despite the office's contact.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation for whose crimes Prince Andrew publicly offered to cooperate.

connections.description: Prince Andrew publicly offered to cooperate with law enforcement investigating crimes committed by Jeffrey Epstein, indicating a prior association relevant to the investigation.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the investigation and has publicly addressed Prince Andrew's lack of cooperation after contacting his attorneys.

events.title: Prince Andrew's Public Offer to Cooperate
events.description: Prince Andrew issued a press release stating he was 'willing to help any appropriate law enforcement agency with their investigations' into Jeffrey Epstein's crimes.

events.title: Geoffrey Berman's Public Statement on Prince Andrew
events.description: At a Safe Horizon press event, U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman stated that Prince Andrew had been contacted for an interview but had provided 'zero cooperation' to the investigation.

locations: Southern District of New York (jurisdiction of the U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: On November 20, 2019, Prince Andrew publicly offered to cooperate with the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's crimes.
By late January 2020, the U.S. Attorney's Office had contacted Prince Andrew's attorneys to schedule an interview but had received no commitment or date.
On January 27, 2020, U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman publicly stated that Prince Andrew had provided 'zero cooperation' to the investigation.
This email, dated January 30, 2020, contains final language intended to be sent, highlighting the discrepancy between Prince Andrew's public offer and his actual lack of cooperation.
